io.grpc.transport

Class Buffers

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.grpc.transport.Buffers

  • public final class Buffers
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for creating Buffer instances.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Buffer empty()
      Returns an empty Buffer instance.
      static Buffer ignoreClose(Buffer buffer)
      Decorates the given Buffer to ignore calls to Buffer.close().
      static java.io.InputStream openStream(Buffer buffer, boolean owner)
      Creates a new InputStream backed by the given buffer.
      static byte[] readArray(Buffer buffer)
      Reads an entire Buffer to a new array.
      static java.lang.String readAsString(Buffer buffer, java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
      Reads the entire Buffer to a new String with the given charset.
      static java.lang.String readAsStringUtf8(Buffer buffer)
      Reads the entire Buffer to a new String using UTF-8 decoding.
      static Buffer wrap(byte[] bytes)
      Shortcut for wrap(bytes, 0, bytes.length.
      static Buffer wrap(byte[] bytes, int offset, int length)
      Creates a new Buffer that is backed by the given byte array.
      static Buffer wrap(java.nio.ByteBuffer bytes)
      Creates a new Buffer that is backed by the given ByteBuffer.

    • Method Detail

      • empty

        public static Buffer empty()
        Returns an empty Buffer instance.

      • wrap

        public static Buffer wrap(byte[] bytes)
        Shortcut for wrap(bytes, 0, bytes.length.

      • wrap

        public static Buffer wrap(byte[] bytes,
          int offset,
          int length)
        Creates a new Buffer that is backed by the given byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array being wrapped.
        offset - the starting offset for the buffer within the byte array.
        length - the length of the buffer from the offset index.

      • wrap

        public static Buffer wrap(java.nio.ByteBuffer bytes)
        Creates a new Buffer that is backed by the given ByteBuffer. Calls to read from the buffer will increment the position of the ByteBuffer.

      • readArray

        public static byte[] readArray(Buffer buffer)
        Reads an entire Buffer to a new array. After calling this method, the buffer will contain no readable bytes.

      • readAsString

        public static java.lang.String readAsString(Buffer buffer,
                            java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Reads the entire Buffer to a new String with the given charset.

      • readAsStringUtf8

        public static java.lang.String readAsStringUtf8(Buffer buffer)
        Reads the entire Buffer to a new String using UTF-8 decoding.

      • openStream

        public static java.io.InputStream openStream(Buffer buffer,
                             boolean owner)
        Creates a new InputStream backed by the given buffer. Any read taken on the stream will automatically increment the read position of this buffer. Closing the stream, however, does not affect the original buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer backing the new InputStream.
        owner - if true, the returned stream will close the buffer when closed.

      • ignoreClose

        public static Buffer ignoreClose(Buffer buffer)
        Decorates the given Buffer to ignore calls to Buffer.close().
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer to be decorated.
        Returns:
        a wrapper around buffer that ignores calls to Buffer.close().
